item.description:
The Osbornedale State Park was willed to the state in 1956 by Francis Osborne Kellogg. The area as used as a farm since the 1600’s, and a silver mine and spring water bottling business was there also. The park is 350 acres with a pond, hills, and hiking trails.

Next to the park is the Osborne Homestead and Kellogg Environmental Education center. You may visit the center after our walk if you like. I am not sure about admission costs.

This will be an easy walk of about 2.5 miles with moderate up hills. Social walking pace. We will be out for 2 hours or as fate may have it. I have not visited this place in many years, and I will be following the trail map. Afterwards we will have a picnic lunch at the picnic area. Alcohol beverages are not allowed (local rules in this park.) The walk will be rescheduled if there is a threat of rain.

Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

Directions: From Route 8 south: Take Exit 17. Take a left at the end of the exit ramp (Seymour Ave). Take another left at the lighted intersection (Division Street). Drive approximately ¾ miles (bearing left onto Chatfield St). Osbornedale State Park will be on the right across from Derby High School.

Location: Approximate address, no mailbox there, GPS not guaranteed to lead you there. 84 Chatfield St, Derby, CT.
http://maps.google.com/maps?q=84+Chatfield+Street,+Derby,+CT&hl=en&ll=41.336486,-73.098205&spn=0.001369,0.002226&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=23.761683,36.474609&oq=84+chatfield+st...
item.how_to_find_us: There may be a parking lot on the left as you enter the park.

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Osbornedale State Park Walk, Derby, CT
